lead_paragraph: More than 145 were wounded when three suicide bombers struck at the international arrivals building of Ataturk airport, officials said.

byline.contributor: Safak Timur contributed reporting from Istanbul, Rukmini Callimachi from Paris, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By TIM ARANGO, SABRINA TAVERNISE and CEYLAN YEGINSU

headline.print_headline: Dozens Left Dead as Attackers Hit Istanbul Airport
headline.main: Istanbul Airport Attack Leaves at Least 41 Dead

snippet: More than 145 were wounded when three suicide bombers struck at the international arrivals building of Ataturk airport, officials said.
abstract: Three suicide bombers carry out rampage at Ataturk airport outside Istanbul, killing at least 36 people and wounding dozens more; incident is latest in series of terrorist attacks in Turkey, once relatively stable NATO ally; Islamic State is thought to be behind assault but has not claimed responsibility.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
